item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Selfish, adj. Devoid of consideration for the selfishness of others." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Patience â€“ A minor form of despair, disguised as a virtue." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Cynic, n. A blackguard whose faulty vision sees things as they are not as they ought to be." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Marvin Simkin
item.description: "Democracy is not freedom. Democracy is two wolves and a lamb voting on what to eat for lunch. Freedom comes from the recognition of certain rights which may not be taken, not even by a 99% vote." -- Marvin Simkin

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Pray, v.</b> To ask that the laws of the universe be annulled in behalf of a single petitioner, confessedly unworthy." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Bore, n.: A person who talks when you wish him to listen." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Conservative, n: A statesman who is enamored of existing evils, as distinguished from the Liberal who wishes to replace them with others." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Lottery: A tax on people who are bad at math." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Absurdity, n.: A statement or belief manifestly inconsistent with one's own opinion." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Politics, n. Strife of interests masquerading as a contest of principles." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Dan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Dan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Dan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here we are, trapped in the amber of the moment. There is no why." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Dan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Being a Humanist means trying to behave decently without expectation of rewards or punishment after you are dead." -- Kurt Vonnegut
